name: Sweet and Sour Chicken (Ootoya Tori Kurozu-An)
description: This Chinese-style Sweet and Sour Chicken uses black rice vinegar to create a deep, malty, and savory sauce. Try my copycat recipe of the popular dish Tori Kurozu-an from the famous Japanese diner Ootoya 大戸屋.

video.name: How To Make Ootoya's Sweet and Sour Chicken (Tori Kurozu-An) (Recipe) 大戸屋「鶏と野菜の黒酢あん」の作り方 （レシピ）
video.description:
This savory and delicious fried chicken and vegetables with sweet black vinegar sauce is a copycat recipe of "Tori Kurozu-An" from Ootoya 大戸屋 restaurant.

For the complete recipe:
http://www.justonecookbook.com/recipes/ootoya-sweet-and-sour-chicken-tori-kurozu-an/

Ingredients:

2 chicken thighs (300 g, 11 oz)
3 small potatoes
3” (8 cm) lotus root
½  carrot 
1 eggplant
½ onion
½ green pepper
½ cup potato/corn starch
3 cups deep frying oil (peanut oil, vegetable oil, canola oil, etc)

Marinade:

2 Tbsp. soy sauce
1 Tbsp. sake
1 tsp. grated ginger with juice
½ tsp. grated garlic

Black Vinegar Sauce:

4 Tbsp. sugar
3 Tbsp. apple cider vinegar
1 Tbsp. black vinegar*
2 Tbsp. soy sauce
1 Tbsp. mirin
1 Tbsp. water
1 Tbsp. sake
2 tsp. potato/corn starch

Note:

*If you use Chinese black vinegar, add 1/2 Tbsp instead of 1 Tbsp.

Music courtesy of Audio Network: "Made-For-Life"
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check out my blog: http://www.justonecookbook.com/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
❀ Follow Just One Cookbook ❀
♥ Google+: https://plus.google.com/u/0/+NamikoChen/
♥ Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/justonecookbook
♥ Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/justonecookbook
♥ Pinterest: http://pinterest.com/justonecookbook/
♥ Instagram: http://instagram.com/justonecookbook
------------------------------------------------------------------------

recipeIngredient: ½ cup potato starch or cornstarch

recipeInstructions.text: Make the marinade. Grate the ginger and collect 1 tsp ginger (with juice). Grate 1 clove garlic. Combine the ginger, garlic, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, and 1 Tbsp sake in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the marinade. Grate the ginger and collect 1 tsp ginger (with juice). Grate 1 clove garlic. Combine the ginger, garlic, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, and 1 Tbsp sake in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Trim off and discard any excess fat from 2 chicken thighs, then cut the meat into bite-sized pieces and add them to the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Trim off and discard any excess fat from 2 chicken thighs, then cut the meat into bite-sized pieces and add them to the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all the ingredients for the Black Vinegar Sauce: 4 Tbsp sugar, 3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 Tbsp Japanese black vinegar (kurozu), 1 Tbsp mirin, 1 Tbsp water, 1 Tbsp sake, and 2 tsp potato starch or cornstarch. Mix it well together.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine all the ingredients for the Black Vinegar Sauce: 4 Tbsp sugar, 3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 Tbsp Japanese black vinegar (kurozu), 1 Tbsp mirin, 1 Tbsp water, 1 Tbsp sake, and 2 tsp potato starch or cornstarch. Mix it well together.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and cut 3 potatoes in half. Peel and cut ½ carrot into small pieces. For the carrot, I use the rangiri cutting technique to create more surface space so that they will cook faster and look pretty.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel and cut 3 potatoes in half. Peel and cut ½ carrot into small pieces. For the carrot, I use the rangiri cutting technique to create more surface space so that they will cook faster and look pretty.

recipeInstructions.text: Potatoes and carrots take too long to cook by deep-frying alone; therefore, we boil them first for 10 minutes until they are tender. Drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Potatoes and carrots take too long to cook by deep-frying alone; therefore, we boil them first for 10 minutes until they are tender. Drain and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and cut 3 inches lotus root (renkon) into ⅛-inch (3-mm) slices. Peel 1 Japanese or Chinese eggplant in a striped pattern and cut it into ½-inch (1.3-cm) slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel and cut 3 inches lotus root (renkon) into ⅛-inch (3-mm) slices. Peel 1 Japanese or Chinese eggplant in a striped pattern and cut it into ½-inch (1.3-cm) slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut ½ onion into wedges and cut the wedges in half crosswise. Cut ½ green pepper into wedges, then cut the wedges in half crosswise.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut ½ onion into wedges and cut the wedges in half crosswise. Cut ½ green pepper into wedges, then cut the wedges in half crosswise.

itemListElement.text: In a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot, add 3 cups neutral oil. Make sure you have at least 2 inches (5 cm) of oil in the pot. Depending on the size of your pot, you may need more or less oil. If you are new to deep-frying, read my post on How to Deep-Fry Food for helpful tips. Preheat the oil to 340ºF (170ºC). Using a paper towel, pat dry the vegetables. Then, add them to the oil and deep-fry until they‘re tender. Be careful not to overcook or undercook. When they’re done, drain them on a wire rack or paper towel.
itemListElement.name: In a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot, add 3 cups neutral oil. Make sure you have at least 2 inches (5 cm) of oil in the pot. Depending on the size of your pot, you may need more or less oil. If you are new to deep-frying, read my post on How to Deep-Fry Food for helpful tips. Preheat the oil to 340ºF (170ºC). Using a paper towel, pat dry the vegetables. Then, add them to the oil and deep-fry until they‘re tender. Be careful not to overcook or undercook. When they’re done, drain them on a wire rack or paper towel.

itemListElement.text: Next, coat the chicken pieces in ½ cup potato starch or cornstarch and deep-fry at 340ºF (170ºC) for 5 minutes or until golden brown. If the chicken is browning too quickly, lower the heat to make sure the chicken gets cooked through. Then, place the chicken pieces on a wire rack or paper towel and drain well.
itemListElement.name: Next, coat the chicken pieces in ½ cup potato starch or cornstarch and deep-fry at 340ºF (170ºC) for 5 minutes or until golden brown. If the chicken is browning too quickly, lower the heat to make sure the chicken gets cooked through. Then, place the chicken pieces on a wire rack or paper towel and drain well.

recipeInstructions.name: To Add the Sauce and Serve

itemListElement.text: When you‘re done deep-frying the chicken, reheat the wok and toss the deep-fried vegetables and chicken together. When they are re-heated evenly, pour the Black Vinegar Sauce over the chicken and vegetables and toss to combine. Transfer the Sweet and Sour Chicken to a plate and serve.
itemListElement.name: When you‘re done deep-frying the chicken, reheat the wok and toss the deep-fried vegetables and chicken together. When they are re-heated evenly, pour the Black Vinegar Sauce over the chicken and vegetables and toss to combine. Transfer the Sweet and Sour Chicken to a plate and serve.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

review.reviewBody:
I made this tonight and it's super delicious! Thanks for sharing this recipe Nami! 
My family loved it too. ❤️

I doubled the amount of sauce for a Costco 2-pack of chicken wings (about 28 pcs.). Kicked it up by sprinkling a handful of chopped green onions and a half-cup of finely chopped pan roasted peanuts to add a Cantonese touch.

Hi Nami

I just want to thank you for this flavourful Ootoya Sweet and Sour Chicken Recipe. It is a real hit with my family. I have also tried replacing the chicken meat with pork and it turns out just as beautifully. Am also glad to be able to replace the ketchup used in most sweet and sour dishes with healthier ingredients like black vinegar, apple cider vinegar and soy (we are thankful that these sauces are found commonly in Singapore). I try to cook something from your list of recipes at least once a week. Thank you again and stay healthy. Love your new pet dog.

Best
CA
Today I made it, tasted so good. i cannot believe I can make this!! my family loved it so much. thanks  for your recipe!!!
